Pollen is only one example of an airborne pollutant. People with allergies are more likely to have respiratory problems when the allergens that trigger their allergies are in the air. However, one of the advantages of using an air purifier is that it may be an excellent tool for reducing some of these symptoms. This type of filter benefits people who suffer from allergies because it removes 99.97 per cent of indoor air pollutants smaller than 0.3 microns.


As a point of reference, a particle of pollen may range in size from 10 to 200 microns, a piece of dust mite excrement can be anywhere from 10 to 40 microns, and the average size of a pet dander is between 5 and 10 microns. Keeping this in mind, an air purifier equipped with a HEPA filter can potentially remove almost all of the most common allergens from the air.


If that isn't the case, scroll down for our tried-and-true roundup of the best air purifiers for allergies. We suggest these purifiers whether you suffer from seasonal allergies like hay fever or difficulties with dust mites or pet dander. Because each of these air purifiers has received a high number of positive ratings from previous customers and has passed our stringent quality assurance testing, you can be certain that you are purchasing a product of high quality.

Molekule Air Pro


The Molekule Air Pro is a high-end air purifier with a streamlined design.



Specifications


· Height: 14.8 (in)

· Diameter: 16.3 (in)

· 7.6 inches in length (in)


REASONS TO BUY


· FDA-cleared

· accommodate every kind of home decoration aesthetic

· Wi-Fi enabled

· 30-day risk-free, in-home trial period with free delivery both ways


REASONS TO AVOID


· Molekule units are compatible with none other than Molekule filters

· Customer service at Molekule is a complicated process


The Molekule range of air purifiers uses both filtration and ultraviolet (UV) radiation to eliminate airborne germs and viruses by capturing and destroying them. They achieve this result using low-energy UV light with two distinct filters. The air in your area is drawn into the cleaners by an internal fan, where it is passed through an external filter and then into a deeper filter. The outside filter is responsible for collecting larger molecules, such as gas particles, mould, and dust.


Inside that deeper filter, the air is made to be exposed to UV radiation, which kills any potentially dangerous microbes that may be present. After then, the air escapes via vents at the very top of the apparatus. This method, in which Molekule's products are the only ones used, is termed photoelectrochemical oxidation, or PECO for short. Molekule is distinct from other air purifiers since it employs UV light to destroy particles. Most other air purifiers rely on HEPA filtration to capture and remove these particles from the air. Molekule uses UV light.


People are becoming more interested in mitigating this danger by using the usage of indoor air purifiers, such as the ones manufactured by Molekule. Molekule claims that its air purifiers can capture and destroy a wide variety of typical indoor air contaminants, ranging from gas-based paint fumes to bacterial spores. Molekule products have been praised by thousands of happy customers for improving the air quality in their homes, reducing allergens like dust and mould, and alleviating the symptoms of seasonal allergies.


However, Molekule air purifiers are not the least expensive on the market, and some people who are passionate about air purifiers claim that you may find a better deal elsewhere. In the end, whether or not investing in a Molekule air purifier is worthwhile for you will depend on your requirements, financial constraints, and expectations.

One of the better models available for those who own pets is the Winix HR900. Most of this air purifier's cleaning power is concentrated on removing odours and particles created by dogs. It won't take long until the scent of pets, their dander, and other odours you don't like are gone.



Specifications

· Pet-filter

· Pre-filter

· HEPA Filter


REASONS TO BUY


· Cool Design

· Smart Sensors

· Auto Mode

· AHAM Verified

REASONS TO AVOID

This prefilter is washable and traps pet hair and other large particles. A carbon filter with washable Advanced Odor Control will ensure that any unpleasant odours caused by pets are eliminated. Additionally, it is effective in eliminating a wide variety of odours. The Winix HR900 is one of the most recent versions that can be purchased from Winix and is specifically designed to deal with pollution caused by pets. Previous versions, such as the Winix 9000 and 9500 and the new HR950, are still viable options.


The True HEPA filter is the fourth and last line of protection against harmful particles. Additionally, the True HEPA filter is the most critical one in the system. Plasma Wave Technology is the last weapon in the fight against pet pollution. The Plasma Wave Technology breaks down on a molecular level any particles, odours, allergies, and other contaminants in space.


Dust and odour sensors are included in the Winix HR900 and may be utilized to make automated adjustments to the fan speed. When you choose this mode, you are giving the air purifier control over the speed of operation, depending on the pollution in the surrounding air. Long-term use of this mode may result in reduced energy use. Because it has light sensors, the air purifier will turn out the light in the bedroom when it is set to automatic mode. However, it will continue to operate in automatic mode, which means it will retain the ability to switch to turbo speed if the level of pollution in the room is very high. If you find that the noise keeps you from getting a good night's rest, then choose the "sleep mode" option.
